perturbation.original_text: Whereas, VAL wishes to engage the Developer for services as an independent contractor for the sole purpose of designing the Duesey Coffee Chinese Mobile Apps and backend software contained for iPhone, iPad, Android (Hereinafter called as the “Project”) developed as per the requirements specifications by VAL within this mobile application development agreement
perturbation.changed_text: Whereas, VAL wishes to engage the Designer for services as an independent contractor for the sole purpose of designing the Duesey Coffee Chinese Mobile Apps and backend software contained for iPhone, iPad, Android (Hereinafter called as the “Product”) developed as per the requirements specifications by VAL within this mobile application development agreement
perturbation.explanation: The terms "Developer" is changed to "Designer" and "Project" is changed to "Product", these terms are used interchangeably without clear distinction in subsequent clauses. This introduces uncertainty about which entity is responsible for development tasks and what constitutes the final deliverable, whether it's the "Project" or the "Product".

perturbation.original_text: All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment to the following individual below within 7 days upon completion and handover on the Project to VAL.
perturbation.changed_text: All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment to the following entity below within 7 days upon completion and handover on the Application to VAL.
perturbation.explanation: The term "individual" is changed to "entity" and "Project" to "Application". While the original text refers to specific individuals, the revised text uses the term "entity," creating ambiguity as to whether payments can be made to a company instead. Replacing "Project" with "Application" creates confusion about the scope of deliverables.

perturbation.original_text: VAL will supply products, logo, pricing and final design approval, multimedia, CMS access.
perturbation.changed_text: VAL will supply deliverables, logo, pricing and final design approval, multimedia, CMS access.
perturbation.explanation: The word 'products' has been changed to 'deliverables'. This change leads to confusion as the agreement elsewhere defines 'deliverables' in the context of the mobile application itself. The scope of 'products' is less well-defined, introducing uncertainty as to what VAL is required to supply, potentially delaying the project.
perturbation.location: SCOPE OF DELIVERABLES - No. 2. Functional requirements & UI/ Multimedia, backend access.
